article.headline: South Alabama 92, Ark.-Little Rock 79
article.story: MOBILE, Ala. -- Martino Brock scored 19 points and was one of seven South Alabama players to score in double figures in a 92-79 victory over Arkansas-Little Rock on Thursday night. The Jaguars (12-14, 6-9 Sun Belt Conference) shot 55 percent from the field (33 of 60). Allyn Cooks had 16 points and Tim Williams had 15. Augustine Rubit and Gary Redus had 11 apiece, with all of Rubit's points coming in the first half. He also had 11 rebounds. Antione Lundy and Javier Carter each had 10. Solomon Bozeman led Arkansas-Little Rock (15-14, 7-7) with 20 points. The Trojans' bid for a first-round bye in the upcoming conference tournament ended. Only the top two teams in each division automatically advance to the quarterfinals, and the loss kept the Trojans fourth in the West Division, 2 1/2 games back of Arkansas State and Louisiana-Lafayette with two conference games to play.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
